findings.title: Multiple contracts: The function onERC20Received() can be called by anyone
findings.description: The message sender is never checked in any of the function `onERC20Received()` implementation. This allows anyone to call the function, potentially leading to unauthorized actions.

findings.title: Incorrect _totalSupply Update in _batchBurnFrom()
findings.description: The function `_batchBurnFrom()` reduces `_totalSupply` supply multiple times by the amount burned so far while executing the loop.

findings.title: Multiple Contracts: The function recoverERC20s() might fail to recover certain ERC-20 tokens
findings.description: The function `recoverERC20s()` will not transfer `ERC20` tokens which `transfer()` function does not return `true`.

findings.title: Bridging contracts: centralized design, the manager role can perform any actions
findings.description: The bridging contracts are controlled by one address, allowing it to withdraw escrow funds anytime by providing a custom log input. This centralization also comes with the risk of getting stolen or lost.
